entry.title: Big Lemon & Paeroa bottle (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that New Zealand's Big Lemon & Paeroa bottle (pictured) was originally a replica space rocket?

entry.title: Georg Karo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Jewish-German Georg Karo was accused of being a Nazi spy after fleeing Nazi persecution?

entry.title: Gracie Graves and the Kids from Room 402 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Gracie Graves and the Kids from Room 402 was criticized for conveying "a sort of smug superiority of adults"?

entry.title: Isabelle Cals (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Isabelle Cals, who turned to singing after a degree in Chinese, appeared as Wagner's Kundry in a production of Parsifal at the Stadttheater Minden?

entry.title: Inferno (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Counter-Strike map "Inferno" encourages the player to massacre chickens?

entry.title: Red Hill Band (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Red Hill Band was commended by the United States Senate in 1965 for its "excellence and its state and community contributions"?

entry.title: AreYouKiddingTV (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that AreYouKiddingTV once gave out $5,000 to a student at East Carolina University who was the first to retrieve a clear key from a pool on campus?

entry.title: Annales des Maladies de la Peau et de la Syphilis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the founder of Annales des Maladies de la Peau et de la Syphilis claimed to have inoculated himself with syphilis?
